Judul: IDENTIFICATION OF FAULT STRUCTURE AND HYDROCARBON PROSPECT AREAS BASED ON INTEGRATION OF GRAVITY ANOMALIES, GEOLOGY AND PRODUCTION WELL ANALYSIS IN THE X OIL FIELD, EAST KALIMANTAN
Abstrak:
This paper presents a new approach for identifying
fault structure and delineating hydrocarbon prospect
areas based on modeling and correlations of gravity
anomalies which are supported by geology and
production well data. For a case study, we used the ‘X’
Oil Field in East Kalimantan-Indonesia which has a
depth of sandstone reservoir around 1200 m. Seismic
data in this area has low quality due to the surface and
subsurface factors. To strengthen the interpretation of
possibility of the new potential area, we conducted
gravity survey covering an area of 6.2 km x 7.4 km
with approximately 250 m station interval. Each
gravity station was measured at the level of height of 0
cm, 55 cm and 90 cm from the surface in order to
calculate the vertical gradient anomalies.
To identify types of fault and its dip of fault plane,
we perform synthetic modeling first based on the ratio
and difference of the maximum positive and negative
SVD (Second Vertical Derivative) anomalies. While
for the delineation of the prospect area, the correlations
between residual anomaly and vertical gradient
anomaly supported by geology and production well
data were used. Based on the lessons learned from the
existence of oil production well and the correlation of
the anomalies, it could be identified that hydrocarbon
prospect area has a low value of vertical gradient
anomaly and a high value of the residual anomaly.
The results show that ‘X’ oil field has four
potential areas to be hydrocarbon prospects which
located in the NW and SE of study area with structural
faulted anticline as the prospect trap. The thickness of
sedimentation basin reaches 4 km. The fault structure
is dominated by normal faults with NE-SW direction
that associated with tensional tectonic setting and the
average dip of structure is about 70 degrees.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Susanti Alawiyah, Darharta Dahrin , Djoko Santoso, Eko Widianto, Setianingsih, Eko Januari Wahyudi , and Arness Adabi
Kata Kunci: residual, SVD, vertical gradient, hydrocarbon prospect
